meanings.definition: To change the basic structure or organization of something.
meanings.sent1: The company restructures its departments to improve workflow.
meanings.sent2: She restructures her essay to make it more coherent.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle restructures itself when you move the pieces around.
meanings.sent4: Like a skilled architect, he restructures the building plans for better stability.
meanings.sent5: The caterpillar restructures its cocoon to prepare for transformation.

meanings.definition: To alter the form or arrangement of something.
meanings.sent1: The artist restructures the painting by adding more colors.
meanings.sent2: He restructures his schedule to fit in more study time.
meanings.sent3: The clouds seem to restructures themselves into different shapes.
meanings.sent4: The river restructures its path after heavy rainfall.
meanings.sent5: The chef restructures the dish presentation for a more appealing look.

meanings.definition: To reorganize or make changes to something in order to improve efficiency or effectiveness.
meanings.sent1: The manager restructures the team to enhance productivity.
meanings.sent2: She restructures her budget to save more money.
meanings.sent3: The robot restructures its code to perform tasks faster.
meanings.sent4: The teacher restructures the lesson plan for better student engagement.
meanings.sent5: The farmer restructures the irrigation system for optimal crop growth.
